qas.question: How many members are in Greece's parliament?
How often are elections help for parliament?
Parliamentary statutes are put into effect by who?

context: Legislative powers are exercised by a <a0_0>300<a0_0/>-member elective unicameral Parliament. Statutes passed by the Parliament are promulgated by the <a2_0>President of the Republic<a2_0/>. Parliamentary elections are held <a1_0>every four years<a1_0/>, but the President of the Republic is obliged to dissolve the Parliament earlier on the proposal of the Cabinet, in view of dealing with a national issue of exceptional importance. The President is also obliged to dissolve the Parliament earlier, if the opposition manages to pass a motion of no confidence.
